content: Critical transition moment: Dad orchestrates formal kickoff 'like college counselors do' with Notion tracker, timeline, structured accountability. Then explicitly transfers ownership: 'Jenny brought you to a point, now you drive it.' Not order-taking relationship - Huda must research, challenge, have point of view. Marks shift from coach-directed to student-driven process.

Major selection goes beyond rankings. USC confusion: Interactive Media & Game Design (BFA, artistic) vs Computer Science Games (BS, technical). Jenny deep dives actual classes, labs, alumni outcomes. Discovery: Student has portfolio (film award, Synthoria, websites). Reframe: 'Don't choose based on acceptance rate.' Principle: Curriculum excitement > perceived competitiveness.

Notion tracker implementation during session: Narrative/identity section, calendar timeline, activities documentation, rec letters, college list with majors. Common App created live with troubleshooting. Discovery: SCA major not showing for early action. Solution: Email admissions directly. Action item: Populate entire tracker independently before next session. Working backwards from requirements.

Parent boundary setting with clarity. Dad concern: 'Other parents blaming coach for outcomes.' Jenny framework: 'I provide framework and expertise, family makes final decisions. Not replacement for parent judgment.' Health prioritization: 'Make sure you recover fully before you try to work again.' Finals season transparency: 'Middle of final season, super busy, but it's been good.'

Early action strategy pivot mid-session. Discovery: School of Cinematic Arts doesn't participate in early action (December 1 vs November 1). Friend misinformation clarified. Freed slot triggers Stanford early action instead. Scholarship concern addressed: December 1 deadline still qualifies for merit aid. Real-time platform navigation reveals system quirks requiring direct college communication.

Implicit factors teaching framework. Dad observation: 'So many implicit things Jenny was doing.' Jenny evaluating: Internships, alumni success, research labs, course sequences, transfer options, job outcomes. Makes invisible criteria visible. Stanford major archaeology: AI ethics interest doesn't exist as major, so explores STS (Science Technology & Society), Communications, Symbolic Systems, Data Science. Shows actual classes.

Session deliverables: Notion tracker populated with USC details, Common App account created, Stanford identified for early action, Science Technology & Society selected as best-fit major. Action items defined: Email USC admissions, research other majors, populate entire college list. Strategic decisions: Stanford early action instead of USC, regular decision for SCA major, major selection based on curriculum excitement.

Multi-platform orchestration: Zoom screen sharing throughout, Notion collaborative editing in real-time, Common App live walkthrough, college website research during session. Documentation strategy: Notion comments for Jenny notes, Dad writing action items live, chat links for resources, screen recordings for visual reference. Communication modes: Synchronous problem-solving, asynchronous text between sessions, email for formal college communication.

Jenny's major expertise revealed: 'Symbolic Systems is my major.' Insider knowledge: 'Communications at Stanford is actually STEM.' Specific classes mentioned: 'Virtual people, lies trust and tech.' Honest assessment: 'People don't like philosophy in SymSys.' Gaming passion validation: 'Most video game classes under STS - Adventures in video gaming and society.' Realistic expectations: 'Not telling Huda to be EE at MIT.'

The Formal Kickoff Protocol: Treat college applications like professional counselor program. Dad framework: 'Fundamentally the time when parents sign kids to counselors.' Create structured tracker, clear timeline, defined roles. Reduces parent anxiety, builds accountability, prevents complacency. Then ownership transfer: 'Jenny brought you to point, now you drive it.' Not order-taking - research, challenge, have point of view. Student becomes driver with coach as navigator.
